t: Amazon's AI stores seemed too magical. And they were. - The Japan Times
s: May 2, 2024 - It partially relied on more than 1,000 people in India who were watching and labeling videos to make sure the checkouts were accurate. Amazon says on its website that Just Walk Out uses "computer vision, sensor fusion and deep learning” but doesn’t mention contractors.

t: Amazon announces Rufus, a new generative AI-powered conversational shopping experience
s: With Rufus, customers are now able to shop alongside a generative AI-powered expert that knows Amazon’s selection inside and out, and can bring it all together with information from across the web to help them make more informed purchase decisions.

t: Amazon Nova AI Challenge: Trusted AI - Amazon Science
s: The Amazon Nova AI Challenge is a global university competition to drive secure innovation in generative AI (GenAI) technology, which focuses on responsible AI and large language model (LLM) coding security.

t: Amazon and The New York Times Announce an A.I. Licensing Deal - The New York Times
s: 1 week ago - In 2023, The Times sued OpenAI and Microsoft for copyright infringement. Now its editorial content will appear across Amazon platforms.

t: r/stocks on Reddit: Amazon abandons grocery stores where you just walk out with stuff after it turns out its "AI" was powered by 1,000 human contractors.

s: April 3, 2024 - The 1,000 contractors in India working on the company’s Just Walk Out technology offer a stark reminder that AI isn’t always what it seems.
